User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Concurso Sprint platform.

stats.description: Aggregated user statistics for performance and engagement.

dailyStreak.description: The user's current daily login streak.

lastLoginDate.description: The last date the user logged in, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

Question.title: Question
Question.description: Represents a question in the question bank.

Materia.description: Subject of the question (e.g., Direito Administrativo).

Ano.description: The year the question was from.

Assunto.description: The specific topic of the question.

Cargo.description: The job position the question is for.

correctAnswer.description: The correct answer to the question.

Prova.description: The name of the exam the question belongs to (optional).

SimulatedExam.title: SimulatedExam
SimulatedExam.description: Represents a simulated exam generated for a user.

difficulty.description: Overall difficulty level of the exam.

questionIds.description: References to Questions included in the exam. (Relationship: SimulatedExam 1:N Question)

score.description: The user's score on the simulated exam.

dateTaken.description: Date the simulated exam was taken.

Flashcard.title: Flashcard
Flashcard.description: Represents a flashcard for studying key concepts.

front.description: The text on the front of the flashcard.

back.description: The text on the back of the flashcard (the answer/explanation).

FlashcardResponse.title: FlashcardResponse
FlashcardResponse.description: Tracks a user's response to a specific flashcard.

status.description: User's self-reported status for this flashcard.

StudySession.title: StudySession
StudySession.description: Represents a study session tracked for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the study session.

startTime.description: Start time of the study session.

endTime.description: End time of the study session.

AiStudyPlan.title: AiStudyPlan
AiStudyPlan.description: Represents a study plan generated by AI for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the study plan.

planDetails.description: Detailed plan generated by the AI. This could be a serialized JSON or a plain text format.

generationDate.description: Date and time when the plan was generated.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support the 'Concurso Sprint' app, focusing on secure, scalable, and debuggable data access. The structure leverages path-based ownership for user-specific data and denormalization to ensure authorization independence, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules.

1.  **Users (`/users/{userId}`):** Stores user profiles. This is the root for all user-owned data and now includes an aggregated `stats` object for performance tracking.
2.  **Questions (`/questions/{questionId}`):**  Stores the question bank. Open for browsing to every authenticated user.
3.  **Simulated Exams (`/users/{userId}/simulatedExams/{simulatedExamId}`):** Each simulated exam is stored as a subcollection under the user who created it, ensuring clear ownership.
4.  **Community Simulados (`/communitySimulados/{simuladoId}`):**  A public collection where a copy of user-created simulados is stored for community access.
5.  **Flashcards (`/flashcards/{flashcardId}`):** Public collection of all flashcards, readable by any authenticated user.
6. **Flashcard Responses (`/users/{userId}/flashcardResponses/{flashcardId}`):** User-specific responses to flashcards to track correct/incorrect answers for review.
7.  **Study Sessions (`/users/{userId}/studySessions/{studySessionId}`):** Study session data is stored under each user to track individual study habits and progress.
8.  **AI Study Plans (`/users/{userId}/aiStudyPlans/{aiStudyPlanId}`):** AI study plans are nested under each user, providing personalized plans.

**Authorization Independence and QAPs:**

*   **Path-Based Ownership:**  Using paths like `/users/{userId}/...` directly encodes ownership into the data structure. Security rules can simply check if `request.auth.uid == userId` to grant access, eliminating the need to read parent documents. This directly addresses Authorization Independence.
*   **Structural Segregation:**  Questions and Flashcards are stored in global collections, separate from user-specific data. This segregation allows for different security rules: open read access for all authenticated users, while user-specific collections are restricted to the owning user. This ensures that listing public content does not require complex filtering logic in rules (QAPs: Rules are Not Filters).
